subject: Re: [junit] Junit suggestions
msgSnippet: Yeap Mike, The problem is not really my problem.... (well some could argue on that but it s something different ;-) ) What I just meant is that JUnit could
messageBody:
Yeap Mike,

The problem is not really my problem....
(well some could argue on that but it's something different ;-) )
What I just meant is that JUnit could notify the idiots like me
that their TestCase is intrinsctly stupidly made.
Calling automatically the setUp & tearDown once before it all starts
is a possible solution...

Thomas,


----- Original Message -----
From: "Mike Clark" <mike@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 15, 2002 3:41 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] Junit suggestions


> Thomas SMETS wrote:
>
> > Hi,
> >
> > I every now & then manage to create TestCase that have the following
> > inconsistency :
> > setUp () & tearDown () implicitely rely on action happening in the
> > "test".
> >
> > This is due to the fact that I break the law of "small methods" but ...
may
> > be JUnit could call once setUp () & tearDown () before calling the first
> > test ?
> >
>
> Actually, your tests are working quite nicely here. Listen to them.
There's
> telling you that the methods have some form of undesirable coupling.
Instead
> of trying to force a specific method sequence, see if you can eliminate
the
> dependency altogether.
>
> Mike
>
> --
> Mike Clark
> Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
